title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create three variables:
1. A 'const' variable called 'city' that stores your favorite city name (as text in quotes)
2. A 'let' variable called 'temperature' that stores the number 72
3. Use console.log to display both variables
instructions:
Create three variables:
1. A 'const' variable called 'city' that stores your favorite city name (as text in quotes)
2. A 'let' variable called 'temperature' that stores the number 72
3. Use console.log to display both variables

hints.text: Remember: const city = 'some city'; and let temperature = 72; Then use console.log for each.

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting 'let' or 'const': Writing just age = 25; instead of let age = 25; In strict mode, this causes an error.
commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction: Forgetting 'let' or 'const': Writing just age = 25; instead of let age = 25; In strict mode, this causes an error.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'let' or 'const' when USING a variable: You only use 'let' or 'const' when CREATING the variable. After that, just use the name:
commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
